title: 'Legendary' Victoria station Tube announcer says he has 'nothing but pure love' for commuters
text:
'Die-in' protest for three cyclists killed on London's roads 
A Tube worker known for his hilarious announcements says he has "nothing but pure love” for the commuters he helps every day. 
London Underground employee Carl Downer regularly brightens up commuters' journeys with his announcements and was filmed earlier this week speaking on the platform at Victoria station. 
The video, in which Mr Downer bids a train farewell by saying “respect, respect, rub a dub style", was posted online by style consultant Leon Brown and has been viewed more than 160,000 times. 
Mr Brown said: "We all know what travelling on the underground can be like – no one smiles! 
"We just want to get where we’re going as quickly as possible so it was great to see Carl being true to himself and his heritage, and bringing a smile to all our faces whilst doing it!" 'Total legend': Carl the Tube announcer in action at Victoria station. (Christian English - Bespoke) 
Jamaican-born Mr Downer, 42, who has worked at Victoria station for 10 years, told the Standard he was grateful for the way people have responded to his approach to the job. 
The 42-year-old customer services assistant said: “Thanks for the love that you have given to me, the abundance of love you have given me. 
“I just want to big up all the massive who have given me love. 
“Without the people this wouldn’t happen. The upbeat Tube announcer brightening up commuters' journeys on the northbound Victoria Line platform. (Christian English - Bespoke) 
“Big respect to all the massive. I have got nothing but pure love for them.” 
He explained the philosophy behind his announcements, saying: “I’ve got a lot of love for the masses, they give love and I give back the same love, for real. 
“You are responsible for you own happiness; you have to make way for a brighter day, for a brighter tomorrow. 
“It is like having summer in winter, people need to come together as one.” 
He added that in the fast-paced city of London, and the recent political climate, it can be difficult to see the positives in life, but said there is always a way. 
Mr Downer, from Peckham, said: “From day one there are always problems. 'Bless up the massive', Tube announcer Carl tells passengers as they board the train. (Christian English - Bespoke) 
“We have to find a way to be happy, to do what brings us joy, keep our heads high and be positive about our situation. 
“Everyone can reach each other and look out for each other as a family. 
“We just have to be positive and see the bigger picture of life.” 
Many Tube users have remarked on Carl’s unique announcements. Tube worker hailed 'total legend' for hilarious train announcement 
“Brilliant,” said Michael Cuschieri. “They should have someone like him at every station. 
"Love it and what a difference it probably made to people on a Monday morning going back to work!” 
Stephanie Smith said: “I’ve heard him before! He’s amazing in the mornings, makes everyone smile. Total legend.” 
Another Facebook user called Rae Charles said: “He has been doing this for years, he is amazing, he makes everyone on the carriage/platform smile”. 
Sandy Gardner added: ”I would definitely miss my train because I would be more interested in watching him – really entertaining!” More about:
